Xinsong Du Graduate Research Assistant

About Me Projects Publications

About Me

I am from Beijing, China. I am currently a third-year Ph.D. student at the Department of Health Outcomes and Biomedical Informatics (HOBI) advised by Dr. Dominick J. Lemas I earned a bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering from Shandong University (Jinan, China), and a master’s degree in computer engineering from the University of Florida. Prior to enrolling in HOBI’s Ph.D. program, Xinsong was a research assistant in the Electrical and Computer Engineering Department where he helped with medical informatics research projects. My current research interests include computational metabolomics and machine learning health applications. During my spare time, I like to play table tennis. I am also a member of Gainesville Table Tennis Club.

Research Projects

RUMP: Reproducible Untargeted Metabolomics Data Processing Pipeline

  • Python, Groovy, Docker, Singularity

Reproducibility remains a challenge for untargeted metabolomics data processing. Here we built a container-based untargeted metabolomics data processing software to enhance reproducibility and facilitate collaborative research.

Check it out

Predicting In-hospital Mortality of Patients with Febrile Neutropenia Using Machine Learning Models

  • Python, Machine Learning

Feasibility of using machine learning models to evaluate mortality risk for adult febrile neutropenia inpatients were evaluated. The result indicates machine learning algorithms achieved promising performance.

Check it out
